intro: Calamintha adscendens, commonly known as mountain germander, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs known for their fragrant leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces a distinctive, mint-like fragrance. Calamintha adscendens is often used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
